name: Elsie
text: Colin is back, and I swear, if he shows me one more glow-in-the-dark slime, I might just lose it!

name: Elsie
text: He thought it’d be a brilliant idea to share his slimes with the other adventurers. Now I’ve got slime-coated tables, sticky boots everywhere, and a clean-up crew that’s not being paid enough. Classic Colin. And don’t even get me started on the smell. If he calls this “progress,” I swear…

name: Elsie
text: Okay, let’s stop talking about Colin before my blood pressure spikes. What about you? I assume your research is coming along without any… gelatinous interruptions?

name: Elsie
text: I’m counting on you to give me some real results. The guild’s been *dying* for more solid data on these creatures, and if we can improve adventurer survival rates, our profits will skyrocket.

name: Elsie
text: Look, I don’t need a masterpiece here, but I do need *something* from you. Any research task you’ve been working on - just finish it and bring me some results. The guild’s depending on it.

name: Elsie
text: I don’t care if it’s slimes, dinglebats, or whatever else you’re studying. Just tick one of those off Gertrude’s list and we’ll be one step closer to getting that field guide together.

name: Elsie
text: Anyway, I’ve got more guild reports to sort through than I care to count, so I’ll leave you to your work. Don’t let me come back and find out you’ve joined Colin’s slime club. Yeah. That’s a thing.
